content:
Hello Blowerians!

There's been an uptick in reported posts lately, for probably obvious reasons. We'd like to make a few points very clear.

1. Criticism of any nation's actions is not considered racism by us.
2. With that in mind, please be careful with your wording, and do not use general racial terms when talking about the actions of governments.
3. We expect all *public* posts that appear on the Local feed to meet a fairly conservative PG-13 standard. This is not just "adult" content, but also violence/gore.
4. When boosting content from others, please keep the above in mind and think about what you're amplifying.

Please note that point 3 especially doesn't mean you can't post things outside of that standard, but use content warnings, post followers-only, or preferably both when doing so.

You're pretty much all good right now, but we may tap this sign a little bit and then as we go along.

Please ask us questions any time if you're unsure about anything! Thanks!

account.note:
... and sort it out

content:
Hi folks! Anyone who's wondering what's up with mastodon.au today - there's an update on the web site now.

https://mastodon.au

The key part any of you who have accounts there probably want to know is:
"For anyone concerned about data loss, everything is up, I can get into everything out-of-band, it's just that they can't reach the internet."

So hang in there. If you're in touch with users there by other means, pass that info along and if we hear more we'll let you know!

content:
Hello friends! We've consolidated all the ways to support The Blower into one handy page!

https://chinwag.au/theblower

The Blower does not require payment for any services, but if you're able to contribute and help us survive it'd be massively appreciated!

We're here for the long haul if you are!

content:
We've updated our privacy policy!

No really, we have.

https://chinwag.au/privacy/

It's not substantially changed at all, except that it's now in that one definitive location and we'll be updating all sites and services to point there instead of having a bunch of slightly different ones all saying "look, we don't ask for much and we don't give it to anyone else anyway unless they have a warrant".

fields.name: Rules
fields.value: https://theblower.au/about

fields.name: Privacy
fields.value: https://chinwag.au/privacy

content:
So ... Threads.

Facebook is coming into this interaction with a long history behind it. It's not a random group or small community with a special interest. It's a behemoth in the explicit business of turning human interactions into money.

They're starting with a negative trust balance. We have no belief that they would ever enter into any arrangement that they were not the sole beneficiary of.

We believe, even if we do not understand or see the mechanisms or tactics, that they intend to exploit us, our users, and our communities.

We will not be entering into any federation with them via their Threads platform or any future services.

If they do nothing but positive things in the network for a few years, they might just start creeping up to the point of "zero trust" we'd offer to any new instance and maybe then we'll be open to discussion.

If you really want to see Threads posts, maybe get a second account somewhere that is federating and try it? You're allowed! There's no limit!

account.note:
... and sort it out

Admins are @mike, @s0, and @shug

fields.name: Support Us!
fields.value: https://chinwag.au/theblower

fields.name: Rules
fields.value: https://theblower.au/about

fields.name: Privacy
fields.value: https://chinwag.au/privacy

content:
The Blower will not be federated with Threads. You won't see their posts, they won't see yours.

Why?

When we defederate (totally disconnect) from another instance, it's almost always for the same reason. A lack of trust. Every instance in this network has different rules, reasons, standards - and that's great. It lets people find a home and a community that suits them.

If an issue arises, we admins sometimes need to get in touch with our counterparts on the other side to resolve things. This could just be by forwarding reports of "hey this account is spamming people", or "this person is threatening that one".

In almost all cases, we trust that their actions will be compatible with the expectations of our local users. We start out treating instances as trusted. This is usually just fine.

Trust builds up over time, or goes down - but if negative interactions are bad or frequent enough, if it seems what they want and what we want are just totally different things, we cut them off.

account.note:
... and sort it out

Admins are @mike, @s0, and @shug

content:
The Blower is a year old today! Thanks to everyone who's joined us over the last 12 months!

The first week was pretty wild. Our plan to slowly and carefully ramp up went out the window when that guy at Twitter said something dumb and a ton of people went looking for something else. There was a lot of frantic hammering at keyboards, but we got through it and we're still here!

We hope that those of you who joined us back then found what you were looking for! Everyone who's rocked up for various reasons since, keep being awesome!

Now let's have some cake. We deserve it.

🎂🎉🎊🎈🥳

#HappyBirthday #fediversary
